sen.j: 田作（たづくり、たつくり）は、カタクチイワシの幼魚の乾燥品、およびそれを調理した料理。
sen.e: Tazukuri (also called tatsukuri) is a dried product of young anchovies or a cuisine that cooked them.
Tazukuri (also called tatsukuri) is a dried product of young anchovies or a cuisine that cooked them.
Tazukuri (also called tatsukuri) is a dried or cooked product of young anchovies.

sen.j: 別名、ごまめ（鱓、五万米、古女）。
sen.e: It is also called Gomame.
It is also called Gomame.
It is also called Gomame.

sen.j: 乾燥させた小魚を乾煎りし、冷ましてから醤油、みりん、砂糖、赤唐辛子を少量、これを煮詰めた液で絡めてつくる。
sen.e: It is cooked by dressing the dried small fish with soy sauce, sweet cooking rice wine, sugar, and a little red pepper after dry-frying them and cooling them.
It is made by dressing the dried small fish with soy sauce, sweet cooking rice wine, sugar, and a little red pepper after dry-frying them and cooling them.
It is made by dressing the dried small fish with soy sauce, sweet cooking rice wine, sugar, and a little red pepper after dry-frying them and cooling them.

sen.j: 絡め過ぎると全部くっついて取れなくなる。
sen.e: When it is dressed too much, each fish sticks with each.
When it is dressed too much, each fish sticks with each.
When it is dressed too much, each fish sticks with each.

sen.j: 正月のおせち料理、特に関東風の祝い肴三種として欠かせないもののひとつである。
sen.e: It is one of necessary ingredients for Osechi-ryori (special dishes prepared for the New Year), especially for Iwaizakana sansyu (three kinds of celebrating dishes) of Kanto-Style.
It is one of the indispensable dishes for Osechi-ryori (special dishes prepared for the New Year), especially for Iwaizakana sansyu (three kinds of celebrating dishes) of Kanto-Style.
It is one of the indispensable dishes for Osechi-ryori (special dishes prepared for the New Year), especially for Iwaizakana sansyu (three kinds of celebrating dishes) of Kanto-Style.

sen.j: 田畑の高級肥料としてイワシが使われていた事から豊作を願って食べられた。
sen.e: Since sardines were used as high-grade fertilizer for the fields, people eat them to wish for good harvest.
Since sardines were used as high-grade fertilizer for the fields, people eat them to wish for good harvest.
Since sardines were used as high-grade fertilizer for the fields, people eat them to wish for good harvest.

sen.j: 別名のごまめ（五万米）はイワシを肥料とすると米が豊作となったことから。
sen.e: Its another name, Gomame, fifty thousands rice, was based on the fact that it got good harvest of rice with the sardine fertilizer.
Its another name, Gomame, fifty thousands rice, was based on the fact that it got good harvest of rice with the sardine fertilizer.
Its another name, Gomame, fifty thousand grains of rice, was based on the fact that the sardine fertilizer produced a good harvest of rice.
sen.cmt: 一部変更しました。fifty thousands rice→fifty thousand grains of rice
